reviews.text: It is also known as Amer fort.  A historical destination in Jaipur.  Beautifully designed and architect.  It is a huge place with a lot of enclaves.  My favorite is the glass room with walls made from mosaic of mirrors. Also there is an elephant 🐘 ride which were awesome.

It is also known as Amer fort. What a wonderful fort it is. You just get amazed with its architecture, carvings and paintings. I loved this fort most in Jaipur Rajasthan. You get an awesome view from the top. You just get a glimpse of how the Royals must have lived. I was so much fascinated by its beauty. I will highly recommend everyone to visit this place if you are in Jaipur.

Wonderful old palace full of history. It's advisable to have a guide to be able to appreciate this incredible building. Do not use elephants to take you up to the palace, it is cruel and very hot for them to go up the steep hill. This practice should be stopped.

A historical destination in Jaipur. Beautifully designed and architect. A must visiting site with family and friends.Great monument of the ancient Indian architecture. The fun part of the visiting of the Amber palace is elephant ride from the parking place to the palace. The palace itself is better to visit with the guide. So, you can enjoy not only the views but also have a chance to find out some interesting facts.

One of the popular forts in Jaipur. It is situated at a high altitude. You can even drive your car on the ramp or walk or have a elephant ride till its gate. Its a must visit place in Jaipur. Its having great ancient architecture. It is around 11km from Jaipur city

The strong climb to reach the top takes you a minimum of one hour, amazing place to roam around and enjoy the architecture of our predecessor's. There are 2 routes one to the top and one into the darkness of the caves. Fun to explore the place. Do be careful of bats in the dark caves
Must visit if you have enough time and good company.

Nice place to explore the ancient culture. Great mix of paintings and sculptures. It will be good if we reach early morning around 8 or 9 because it will be hot in the afternoon. Requires 2 to 3 hours to roam all around. Somewhat difficult for the old aged people but they also provide carriers for that. Food option is available. And drinking water is also available near the caves

One can experience the thinking power of older engineers or say structure builders bcz the way this fort has built is just amazing.. One civil engineer or warrior can understand it easily.. U won't find any connected door in single line.. When will reach on top u will understand the whole plan of this fort.. There are some tricky ways to misguide the opponents, they were using those for attacks that time.. accordingly they have build this huge structure.. It's really interesting to understand this fort from inside..

Note:-Also u will find so many monkeys there so beware of them if carrying any food etc..  Washroom is available at d base of fort..and 
It's worth going till the top as u can see a superb view from the top of the fort.. 
Prefer morning time.. 😇😊

Nice place to visit.
It's one of the cultural heritage site for Maharshtra state. The fort have long history of various emperor.
The structure of fort is one of it's kind.
If possible hire a guide if possible else you might not get to know many details..
Visiting Devagiri fort good experience for me. I visited on March month. Quite dry and hot. Good place. Nicely carved the mountain to make a fort.

Another marvelous fort in India. Better go in the evening, you can enjoy the beautiful of the fort when its eliminated with lights. You will need stamina to climb the stairs. What an engineering marvel. If you are visiting with family, better to get a guide so you can get to know about the history of the place. Can easily spend half day here. Overall amazing experience.

This is the beautiful fort and well maintained it's a great place if you are interested in architecture there are many tourists guides they will you the history of that place behind the stories everywhere.......
A place worth a visit of trying to cover special places of Hyderabad well maintained might get tired of travelling with kids light show of evening is good but it can be improved and the only downside is steps that you have to climb and finally it's a wonderful place...

This is the beautiful fort. well maintained. Great place if you are interested in architecture. There are many tour guides that will help you with the history of that place behind the stories everywhere. "The only negative step that you have to climb up". Make sure you are in the best of your endurance! This is more challenging because the flight of the whole step is in the scorching sun. Do not forget your  sunglasses, hat and umbrella or cap and water as it will be very sunny. Washrooms are available. A little shaded place where someone can relax. It's better to go early in the morning because the sunlight will be less. 
Your trip to Hyderabad is not complete without visiting Golkonda Fort, you should visit once. Such a wonderful monument !! Good place to spend with both family and friends
You can see the city's good view from the fort. " Importantly If you are interested in history, then rent a guide from the ticket counter."

Its a great piece of architecture. The fort is well maintained and clean. One will require an average time of 3 hrs to see the fort. Clean washrooms are available. One has to carry enough water as the journey to the interiors is a tedious one. Its better to visit the place early in the morning. The fort represents the cultural heritage of Hyderabad. One can also visit the light show in the evening. It is definitely a mesmerizing site. I'll highly recommend this place.

What a Fort on the Deccan plateau. Must visit when in Hyderabad. Should take a guide. Will definitely enhance your experience in roaming around the fort. Such thought and super planning gone in making such forts is worth giving a thought. The sound through the walls amazed me to infinity. The clap room was out of this world.

It is also known as Amer fort.  A historical destination in Jaipur.  Beautifully designed and architect.  It is a huge place with a lot of enclaves.  My favorite is the glass room with walls made from mosaic of mirrors. Also there is an elephant 🐘 ride which were awesome.

It is also known as Amer fort. What a wonderful fort it is. You just get amazed with its architecture, carvings and paintings. I loved this fort most in Jaipur Rajasthan. You get an awesome view from the top. You just get a glimpse of how the Royals must have lived. I was so much fascinated by its beauty. I will highly recommend everyone to visit this place if you are in Jaipur.

The fun part of the visiting of the Amber palace is elephant ride from the parking place to the palace. The palace itself is better to visit with the guide. So, you can enjoy not only the views but also have a chance to find out some interesting facts.

One of the popular forts in Jaipur. It is situated at a high altitude. You can even drive your car on the ramp or walk or have a elephant ride till its gate. Its a must visit place in Jaipur. Its having great ancient architecture. It is around 11km from Jaipur city

It is a beautiful place in Jaipur. The best place which I liked most in Jaipur. Went there for sunset. And the view from above was beautiful. You can go with your bike or car.

 They way is also good where you can see scenic beauty. You will be able to see the entire city from the top of the mountain where you can feel the cool breeze during winter and a great feel. And you can enjoy the history of Jaipur😁

Best place to visit if you love heights along with heritage. 
450meters+ height with amazing view of PINK CITY. One of the best places in Jaipur. Nahargarh is one of the three forts in Jaipur.

 There is View Point from where you can see the whole city. There's Sun Rise point, Sunset Point, Jaipur Wax Museum, And The Cafe which is open for Night view from the top point of Nahargarh Fort. 

In short, Amazing place.

Happy journey 😊

Awesome place for picnic and evening out. It's the highest place of Jaipur from where you can see entire Jaipur. 
So many movies have been shooted over here. 
It's good location to spend time with your family ,friends and loving one.
People prefer to go in groups.
In the night you can see a awesome view of Jaipur like a shiny city.
Whole year is the good time to visit this place but in summers evening would be great time.

One of the best place in Jaipur. Enjoy the sunset on top of the city. City view is the major attraction of this palace. I had my best dinner with sparkling Jaipur in the night. Padav restaurant in the end of Nahargarh fort will give you the best view of the city from the top. This fort is surrounded by huge boundary walls so sit and relax at any of the watch tower and feel the breeze.

Super awesome views of the city. You can walk from Nahargarh Palace Hotel (on the ground next to the hill) to the top in about 20-30 minutes. Would recommend, since it's free and has great views. Also it's much faster and cheaper than going via the Amer area. Only downside is that the entrance to the fort is a little too touristy for my taste (many shops and a random wax museum). Might be nice for others though.

Nice place to spend some time. The nine Chambers or places of the queens are great to visit. The rooftop of the fort is a nice place to hang around and get a good view of the Jaipur city. The sunset view from here is amazing.

The Red fort is our one of the best heritage place.. Good Tourists place The Red Fort is one of the most popular monuments in the history of India. It has a big area for the visitors to watch over. Different sections have their own importance. Highlighted. It has also has a museum showcasing various historic parts of the past. Be it uniforms, Spears, swords or old telephonic instruments. A good watch. But a big factor to be considered is the weather. It's an open air place, so if you go on a sunny day make it a point to carry your goggles and cap. Not to forget drinking water. The place is facilitated with I public washrooms and drinking water. But please choose a pleasant weather period to visit or else you'll be drenched in sweat.

Visited as a guest in the restaurant for lunch just today. We were entertaining friends , and enjoyed our ocean side table. We chose to stay indoors - to enjoy the air conditioning 😊. I just want to say that, in addition to a nice meal, we had a delightful waitress, Jackie. She had just the right balance of friendliness and efficiency. She recognized that we wanted time to visit and did not rush us. She and other staff members made certain that we had everything we needed. Kudos!

The place is great. It is a vast fort and if u want to enjoy properly you may have to roam for the whole day. It has beautiful greenery inside and also the famous market. You can also see the place from where the prime minister of india gives speech on republic and independence day. And not gar away you can get some great street food. So please do visit this place. It is red heaven😍

It is a historical place. Hawa Mahal is a beautiful structure predominantly a high wall made up of red sandstone. Good to know about some history. Guides are available @200 and are of very much helpful. If you have no idea, better to go with Guide. The visiting time closes at 4:30pm. DO HIT THE LIKE BUTTON IF THIS WAS HELPFUL.

Hawa Mahal is a beautiful structure predominantly a high wall made up of red sandstone. The visiting time closes at 4:30pm. But the best time to visit according to me is in the evening. In the evening the yellow lights is flashed on the wall and its the most beautiful site. People come here for sightseeing the beautiful colours that the wall has to give. The Mahal is in the streets so it attracts a lot of crowd and traffic

Nice Hawa Mahal is a beautiful structure predominantly a high wall made up of red sandstone. The visiting time closes at 4:30pm. But the best time to visit according to me is in the evening. In the evening the yellow lights is flashed on the wall and its the most beautiful site. People come here for sightseeing the beautiful colours that the wall has to give. The Mahal is in the streets so it attracts a lot of crowd and traffic

It is a historical place. It us built in form of wall as the ladies used to watch road fests from there.
Name is very justified. Even the loo feels cool there. Amazing views from the top floor. Amazing infrastructure. Too many windows which gives  really cool atmosphere .

Nice place. It's name justify this place. Place is very cool even on summers. You can feel the cool breeze from every   window.
It it not wheel chair accessible.
There are 6-8 sculptures belong to 8 B.C to 17A.D
If you are a history lover then you will like this place. If you have some history knowledge then you will enjoy then other people.
It cost you only 50 rs.

It is good to be there. At present we can only have a look at it from roadside. But it's location amidst the water is nice to see. And boating facility good if it is reopened. At present we are free to have a look at it from the roadside. No need of paying money for visiting the place or for the parking.

It is good to be there. At present we can only have a look at it from roadside. But it's location amidst the water is nice to see. And boating facility good if it is reopened. At present we are free to have a look at it from the roadside. No need of paying money for visiting the place or for the parking.

Possibly the most serene sight amidst the chaos of Jaipur is the beautiful Jal Mahal Jaipur, the Water Palace. This low-rise symmetrical palace, that once was a shooting lodge for the Maharajah, appears to float in the centre of Sagar Lake. The light sand coloured stone walls of the Jal Mahal Jaipur are at a stark contrast to the deep blue of the waters of the lake, while from the innards of the palace lush foliage sprouts.

This majestic scene makes the Jal Mahal Jaipur’s most photographed (and photograph friendly) monument but unfortunately exploration of the actual palace is off limits to the majority of visitors as it is to be transformed into an ultra exclusive restaurant.

Wonderful tourist attraction. Structure and surroundings look magnificent during day as well as night. You can find numerous migratory birds in day time. At present we can only have a look at it from roadside. But it's location amidst the water is nice to see.

A beautiful structure located in the middle of a lake. The building has a garden at top level and trees are seen from distant. The building creates a majestic view at night when the reflection of the building is seen into the water. This is also one of the top tourist spots of Jaipur.
